title.rendered: Find Rooms for Rent in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

content.rendered:
“My place is on the Grand Strand” or “I live near the beach” are undeniably cool ways to introduce yourself. Start your search for cheap rooms for rent in Myrtle Beach, and this could be you!

Myrtle Beach, in Horry County, South Carolina, hosts over 13 million visitors every year. Crowds are drawn in by the area’s abundant entertainment, fantastic location, family attractions, beach activities, and wide range of restaurants and lodging.

Uncovering cheap rooms for rent in Myrtle Beach is Roomi’s specialty! Let us introduce you to the area, and inform you of the best ways to find a room for rent in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina.

Related: Time to move to another city?

Getting to know Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

Myrtle Beach is a coastal city located on the East Coast of the United States. In the center of a continuous 60-mile (97-km) stretch of beach known as “The Grand Strand” in northeastern South Carolina, lies Myrtle Beach.

Myrtle Beach experiences a humid subtropical climate. Summers are hot and humid, and winters are brief and stormy, and it is wet and partly cloudy year-round.

Finding rooms for rent in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

Find A Room For Rent In Myrtle Beach, SC

Establish your list of must-have features before looking for rooms for rent in Myrtle Beach. Locating cheap rooms for rent may prove to be a challenge; inexpensive accommodation in Myrtle Beach does exist but doesn’t stay on the market for long. The average rent is $1,100 and the market for cheap rooms for rent in Myrtle Beach can be competitive.

Top Neighborhoods in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

Before you look into the neighborhoods, get to know the pros and cons of living in Myrtle Beach, SC.

  • Market Common: The neighborhoods in this master-planned wonder revolve around a shopping and dining business district. This neighborhood makes for a great place to find cheap rooms for rent in Myrtle Beach!
  • Carolina Forest: Located west of Myrtle Beach and east of Conway, Carolina Forest was once covered in dense foliage and longleaf pines. Carolina Forest has its own schools, post office, medical offices, and shopping center. The average rent here is $1,100 per month.
  • Conway: A southern community and one of the oldest, Conway has all the allure of a historic district and is a part of the Myrtle Beach Metropolitan area. Resident glass artists Ed Streeter & Barbara Streeter teach glass blowing and the studio hosts free glass blowing demonstrations October through May.

Related: No time for hobbies? See how to do it right.

Average rent in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

This does vary based on factors such as career, average salary and, the real estate market of each area.

University Life in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

Some higher education options in the area include:

  • Coastal Carolina University
  • Horry-Georgetown Technical College
  • Southern Community College
  • Webster University, Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
  • Myrtle Beach College

Living in Myrtle Beach can lighten the stress of adjusting to a new – often stressful! – way of life. Parties during Spring Break are another great way for students to let their hair down here.

Related: Types of Room-mates in College

How Transit Friendly is Myrtle Beach, South Carolina?

The Waccamaw Coast Regional Transportation Authority (Coast RTA) is the primary public transportation system along the Coastal Carolina region (which includes Myrtle Beach, Surfside Beach, Conway, Loris, and Aynor). You can also get to Garden City, Murrells Inlet, Pawleys Island, Georgetown, and Andrews.

Coast RTA

Coast RTA phone number is 843-488-0865.

1. Walkability

Myrtle Beach is a large area, and walking is not advised; it’s usually best to take a car to get the most out of your stay/vacation/re-location. A few walkable suburbs in Myrtle Beach include:

  • Murrells Inlet.
  • Surfside Beach.
  • Atlantic Beach, nicknamed the ‘Black Pearl’.

2. Taxis

Taxi services are plentiful and easily available. Be sure to take one when you’re looking for rooms to rent in Myrtle Beach:

  • City Cab.
  • Royal Cab of Myrtle Beach.
  • Carolina Forest Taxi.

3. Public transportation

The Coast RTA local bus service is affordable and convenient, traveling along major thoroughfares to and from the Grand Strand. Here’s why locals love The Coast RTA:

  • Fixed Route Bus System.
  • Free Seasonal Entertainment Shuttle runs daily throughout the summer months.
  • Paratransit provides independent transportation.

4. Cycling

Plenty of bike trails and parks exist in Myrtle Beach, making cycling a great way to look for cheap rooms for rent in Myrtle Beach.

Check out The City Council’s list of bicycle dos and don’ts along with maps and routes before you get started.

Myrtle Beach Police Patrol

Restaurants in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

Myrtle Beach has a plethora of great restaurants all over the Grand Strand.

  • Seafood World – seafood and steak buffet: From fresh, delectable seafood to non-seafood and vegetarian menus, they cater to all palates at a fair price.
  • Giant Crab (Seafood Restaurant): Even if seafood isn’t your thing, there is a vast array of palatable assortments at their ‘carving station’.
  • Gulf Stream Cafe – With a waterfront view and a rooftop deck, this scenic cafe serves authentic southern coastal cuisine.

Historical/Cultural Spots in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina

The Myrtle Beach area has a rich history and is home to several historical museums, art galleries, beautifully landscaped gardens, talented theater troupes, and a broad range of musical offerings.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Myrtle Beach, South Carolina? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
